column1: Web Site|Meet Loretta|On the Issues|Helping You|Newsroom|Contact MeDear Friend –Representing Orange County in Congress and working for you back home is truly an honor and a privilege.
As 2014 draws to a close, I want to share with you some of what I've been working on this year.
Over the course of the year, my casework teamresolved over 150 issuesbetween residents and federal agencies.
In total, wehelped return almost $145,000 to residentsfrom federal agencies like the Veterans Administration and the Social Security Administration.

Throughout 2014 I visited countless schools and businesses and held over47 Orange County community events , including:13 incometax assistancedays10 events about theAffordable Care Act7 collegefinancial aidnights7 workshops and information sessions forveterans, students and homeowners6 Town HallsIn Washington, D.C,I sponsored and co-sponsored 54 bills , including:The Middle Class CHANCE Act , which makes college more affordable by restoring the strength of federal Pell GrantsThe Central American and USA Initiatives Act , which addresses the humanitarian crisis at our border by helping secure Mexico's southern border and making our short term detention standards more humaneThe Human Trafficking Detection Act , which gives Homeland Security officials the training they need to identify trafficking victims and save livesThe She is Ready (SIR) Act , which removes artificial barriers for women to enter military combat positionsAnd as your voice in Congress, I make it a priority to listen to and respond to your concerns.
This year,I sent almost 30,000 pieces of mail or email in response to resident inquiries .
Please always feel to reach out to my office with any question or concerns – that's why we're here.
Thank you for staying connected to my office, and I hope to keep in touch in 2015.
Very truly yours,Loretta SanchezMember of CongressPrivacy Policy|Unsubscribe
